intro: Miconia leamarkgrafii, commonly known as the golden miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered inflorescences with bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
